page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable extensions to existing encroachments

Fig 19 Allowable extensions of existing walls that encroach into required yards (on ground floor only)

A Extension of existing side yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required interior side yard setback but is at least 5'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less.
Note: In the example below, two existing walls are encroaching--only one of them may be extended.

B Extension of existing front yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required front yard setback but is at least 14'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, with both of the following provisions:
1) the length of the extension is no greater than the length of the existing encroaching wall,
2) the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house.

C Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the required street side yard setback but is at least 5'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback, in one direction only, at the ground floor only, for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less.

Note:
• Encroaching walls that don't meet the minimum setback given for each case (e.g., 5', 14', and 10'), may not be extended nor may they may not be stepped back and then extended.

• Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion.

• Only for structures that were legally constructed, without a variance or an home-improvement exception (HIE).

• Only once in the life of the structure.

• Requires retention of the non-complying wall.

• Exceptions apply to special setbacks as well.

Key
_____ Lot line

visual_elements.description: Three architectural site plan diagrams showing different scenarios for extending existing encroachments. Each diagram shows a property lot with existing house (gray), proposed addition (black), required setbacks (dashed lines), and various yard areas labeled. Diagram A shows side yard extension, Diagram B shows front yard extension with measurements, and Diagram C shows street-side yard extension.

Legend/Key showing different line types and patterns: solid line for lot line, dashed line for required setback, dotted line for buildable area, hatched pattern for sidewalk, gray fill for existing house, and black fill for addition

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from property line for side yard encroachment extension
Maximum extension distance for side yard encroachment
Minimum distance from property line for front yard encroachment extension
Maximum combined length for front yard extension
technical_specifications.value: one-half the maximum width of the house

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from property line for street-side yard encroachment extension
Maximum extension distance for street-side yard encroachment

Only once in the life of the structure

for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less
In the example below, two existing walls are encroaching--only one of them may be extended

An existing wall that encroaches into the required street side yard setback but is at least 5'-0" from the property line, may be extended at the same setback
for a distance equal to the length of the existing wall or 20' whichever is less
the length of the extension is no greater than the length of the existing encroaching wall
the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house

conditions.text: Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion

logical_relationships.expression: Side yard extension requires both minimum setback AND maximum distance limits
Front yard extension requires minimum setback AND both provision conditions
Street-side yard extension requires both minimum setback AND maximum distance limits
Maximum extension distance is length of existing wall OR 20' whichever is less

execution_sequence.action: Verify existing wall meets minimum setback requirement
